meta.title: Batch AVIF to JPG/PNG converter with ZIP download
meta.description: Convert dozens of AVIF images to JPG or PNG in seconds, with no installs and an optional organized ZIP download.

hero.title: Batch convert AVIF to JPG/PNG with one click
hero.subtitle: Upload multiple AVIF images, choose the output format, and download everything inside a share-ready ZIP. Free, no signup, 100% in your browser.

why.title: Why do you need a batch AVIF converter?

items.title: Real-world compatibility
items.desc: Many CMSs, legacy browsers, and mobile apps still can't read AVIF. Mass converting to JPG/PNG prevents broken uploads.

items.title: Save production time
items.desc: Handling files one by one is slow and error-prone. Batch mode lets you process dozens of images in a single run.

items.title: Ready for every channel
items.desc: JPG works better on social media and blogs; PNG keeps transparency for logos, UI, or product listings.

features.title: Core features of the batch converter

upload.title: Bulk upload with thumbnails
upload.desc: Drag several AVIF images or pick them from your file explorer. To keep things smooth we recommend batches of up to 50 files - you can always split them. After uploading, thumbnails let you review every item quickly.
upload.imageAlt: Interface showing thumbnails after uploading several AVIF images

zip.title: Automatic ZIP download
zip.desc: Once conversion finishes, hit "Download all (ZIP)" to grab every JPG/PNG in a single package. Filenames stay intact and you can still download individual images if you need.
zip.imageAlt: ZIP download button highlighted after completing the conversion

formats.title: JPG and PNG outputs in the same batch
formats.desc: Switch between JPG (maximum compatibility) and PNG (for transparent backgrounds) within the same session. There's no need to rerun the process for each format.
formats.imageAlt: Tabs to choose AVIF to JPG or AVIF to PNG inside the converter

local.title: Local processing, no installs
local.desc: Everything runs inside your browser; files never leave your device. Works on Chrome, Edge, Firefox, or Safari, both desktop and mobile.

unlimited.title: Unlimited and free
unlimited.desc: No accounts, no subscriptions, and no hidden caps. Use it for one-off requests or daily production pipelines.

items.title: 1. Upload AVIF files
items.desc: Click "Select files" or drop your images. For heavier jobs, split them into groups of up to 50 files and remove or reorder items whenever necessary.

items.title: 2. Choose the output format
items.desc: Select JPG for lightweight, broadly compatible files, or PNG when you need to preserve transparency and solid colors.

items.title: 3. Convert and download
items.desc: Press "Convert" to process the batch. Then download images individually or use "Download all (ZIP)" for the entire package.

items.question: How many images can I convert at once?
items.answer: There's no hard limit; it depends on your device's RAM and CPU. We suggest batches of up to 50 images for smooth performance; if you need hundreds, split them into multiple runs.

items.question: Does the ZIP change file names?
items.answer: No. The ZIP keeps the original names and the order of the batch so you can identify every file easily.

items.question: Do I have to download the ZIP if I only need a few files?
items.answer: No, each converted image can be downloaded individually. The ZIP is just a shortcut for sharing or archiving the whole batch.

items.question: Does conversion use a lot of resources?
items.answer: It uses your browser's resources. Close heavy tabs, work in moderate batches, and refresh the page if you notice slowdowns; that prevents crashes.

items.question: Should I compress images before converting?
items.answer: Only if you want even smaller outputs. The converter already produces optimized JPGs while keeping quality, but you can pre-compress AVIF files if needed.

tips.title: Tips and best practices
items: Organize folders by project, client, or date so you can package and send them faster after conversion.
Set a naming convention (e.g., product_color.avif) before uploading so the converted files keep the same order.
Clear your browser cache periodically when working with large batches; it frees memory and avoids freezes.
On iOS or Android, add the tool to your home screen for quick access and import images straight from the gallery or file manager.
After downloading the ZIP, upload it to your shared cloud (Drive, Slack, Teams) so the entire team gets every image at once.
